title: 旧约 - 约伯记(Job) - 第 3 章
subTitle: 旧约 -- 约伯记(Job) -- 第 3 章 ( 本篇共有 42 章 )

lineList.en: After this opened Job his mouth, and cursed his day.
lineList.cn: 此后，约伯开口咒诅自己的生日，说，

lineList.en: And Job spake, and said,
lineList.cn: 愿我生的那日，

lineList.en: Let the day perish wherein I was born, and the night in which it was said, There is a man child conceived.
lineList.cn: *和说怀了男胎的那夜都灭没。

lineList.en: Let that day be darkness; let not God regard it from above, neither let the light shine upon it.
lineList.cn: 愿那日变为黑暗。愿神不从上面寻梢它。愿亮光不照于其上。

lineList.en: Let darkness and the shadow of death stain it; let a cloud dwell upon it; let the blackness of the day terrify it.
lineList.cn: 愿黑暗和死荫索取那日。愿密云停在其上。愿日蚀恐吓它。

lineList.en: As for that night, let darkness seize upon it; let it not be joined unto the days of the year, let it not come into the number of the months.
lineList.cn: 愿那夜被幽暗夺取，不在年中的日子同乐，也不入月中的数目。

lineList.en: Lo, let that night be solitary, let no joyful voice come therein.
lineList.cn: 愿那夜没有生育，其间也没有欢乐的声音。

lineList.en: Let them curse it that curse the day, who are ready to raise up their mourning.
lineList.cn: 愿那咒诅日子且能惹动鳄鱼的，咒诅那夜。

lineList.en: Let the stars of the twilight thereof be dark; let it look for light, but have none; neither let it see the dawning of the day:
lineList.cn: 愿那夜黎明的星宿变为黑暗，盼亮却不亮，也不见早晨的光线（光线原文作眼皮）。

lineList.en: Because it shut not up the doors of my mother's womb, nor hid sorrow from mine eyes.
lineList.cn: 因没有把怀我胎的门关闭，也没有将患难对我的眼隐藏。

lineList.en: Why died I not from the womb? why did I not give up the ghost when I came out of the belly?
lineList.cn: 我为何不出母胎而死。为何不出母腹绝气。

lineList.en: Why did the knees prevent me? or why the breasts that I should suck?
lineList.cn: 为何有膝接收我。为何有奶哺养我。

lineList.en: For now should I have lain still and been quiet, I should have slept: then had I been at rest,
lineList.cn: 不然，我就早已躺卧安睡。

lineList.en: With kings and counsellors of the earth, which built desolate places for themselves;
lineList.cn: 和地上为自己重造荒邱的君王，谋士。

lineList.en: Or with princes that had gold, who filled their houses with silver:
lineList.cn: 或与有金子，将银子装满了房屋的王子一同安息。

lineList.en: Or as an hidden untimely birth I had not been; as infants which never saw light.
lineList.cn: 或像隐而未现，不到期而落的胎，归于无有，如同未见光的婴孩。

lineList.en: There the wicked cease from troubling; and there the weary be at rest.
lineList.cn: 在那里恶人止息搅扰，困乏人得享安息。

lineList.en: There the prisoners rest together; they hear not the voice of the oppressor.
lineList.cn: 被囚的人同得安逸，不听见督工的声音。

lineList.en: The small and great are there; and the servant is free from his master.
lineList.cn: 大小都在那里。奴仆脱离主人的辖制。

lineList.en: Wherefore is light given to him that is in misery, and life unto the bitter in soul;
lineList.cn: 受患难的人，为何有光赐给他呢。心中愁苦的人，为何有生命赐给他呢。

lineList.en: Which long for death, but it cometh not; and dig for it more than for hid treasures;
lineList.cn: 他们切望死，却不得死。求死，胜于求隐藏的珍宝。

lineList.en: Which rejoice exceedingly, and are glad, when they can find the grave?
lineList.cn: 他们寻见坟墓就快乐，极其欢喜。

lineList.en: Why is light given to a man whose way is hid, and whom God hath hedged in?
lineList.cn: 人的道路既然遮隐，神又把他四面围困，为何有光赐给他呢。

lineList.en: For my sighing cometh before I eat, and my roarings are poured out like the waters.
lineList.cn: 我未曾吃饭就发出叹息。我唉哼的声音涌出如水。

lineList.en: For the thing which I greatly feared is come upon me, and that which I was afraid of is come unto me.
lineList.cn: 因我所恐惧的临到我身，我所惧怕的迎我而来。

lineList.en: I was not in safety, neither had I rest, neither was I quiet; yet trouble came.
lineList.cn: 我不得安逸，不得平静，也不得安息，却有患难来到。
